msItem.title: Life of St Brendan
msItem.incipit:
Seint brandan þe holy monk was ȝond in erlond
Monk he was of hard lyf as ich ondirstond
msItem.explicit:
An abbey þer is arered þat his body was In do
Nouȝ god vs brynge to þylke Ioye as his soule wente to
msItem.note: Seint brandan þe holy monke was ffand in Irlande added at the head of fol. 1r.
List of contents in the scribe’s hand, in red ink, with added item numbers.
Continuation of the list of contents in black ink, likely in the same hand as one that adds item numbers and titles to the head of individual items within the manuscript.

msItem.title: Life of St Patrick (with his Purgatory)
msItem.incipit:
Seyn pateryk com þoru godes grace to preche In irelonde
to teche men here ryȝte be leue Ihesu cryst to vnderstonde
msItem.explicit:
Now god lete vs so oure synne bete for his holy wounde
So þat we In purgatorye by leue lyte stounde
msItem.note: Final rubric pasted over with a contemporary correction slip, replaced with the opening rubric for the following work. This was temporarily removed during conservation, with a photograph added to the accompanying fascicule of fragments.

msItem.title: Life of St Christina
msItem.incipit:
Seyn cristyne þe holy þyng as I ȝou telle can
Holyff ledde & clene & wel ȝonge by gan
msItem.explicit:
Wit turmentes as ȝe habbeþ I herd wit woundes meny on
now god for þe loue of here þedir vs brynge echon

msItem.title: Life of St Oswald the King
msItem.incipit:
Seynt oswold þe gode kyng of þe on ende of ingelonde
Kyng was as fel þulke tyme In norþ homberlonde
msItem.explicit:
Now seynt oswold þe martyre oure erande so bede
Þat oure lord sende helpe to alle þat habbeþ nede

msItem.title: Feast of the Circumcision
msItem.incipit:
Ȝeris & day þe holy feste hy dey is & gode
for þylke day oure swete lord schadde fyrst his blode
msItem.explicit:
now Ihesu I syrcumsysed was on erþe for al man kynne
graunt vs heuene blysse & schel vs alle fram synne

msItem.title: The Expanded Nativity
msItem.incipit:
Out of Sesar augostus þer com a soche lym
Þat was fram þe emperour þat hyȝt octauyan
msItem.explicit:
& þus endeþ þe gospel amyd winter nyȝt
now crist vs sende helpe of soule þat al may dele & dyȝt
msItem.note: Extract, 156 lines corresponding to verses 219–372 with an added final couplet.

msItem.title: ‘Euangelium In principio’
msItem.incipit:
In þe by gynnyng of þe fadir þe sone was & is
& þe sone was a nente god & god was sone I wis
msItem.explicit:
now seynt Jhon þe euangelist þat gode mon art & hende
praye to hym þat vs made þe Ioye of heuene vs sende

msItem.title: Southern Passion
msItem.incipit:
After two dawes ȝe wete wel þat ester schal come
Whan goddes son schold be I take to gewes & ek I nome
msItem.explicit:
& bryng vs to oure eritage In to þy wonyng
þou graunte vs lord þat we so mote Ihesus almyȝty kyng

msItem.incipit:
Þe holy feste of ester comeþ after lente anon
As oure lord aros fram deþ to lyue boþe in flesch & bon
msItem.explicit:
nouȝ god for his holy body þat for vs was i nome
let vs so his flesch afonge þat we to heuene come

msItem.incipit:
tomas on of þe twelue þat in to name was
I cleped tomas longe in doute myd þe oþer nouȝt nas
msItem.explicit:
& bryng vs to oure eritage In to þy wonyng
þou graunte vs lord þat we so mote Ihesus almyȝty kyng

msItem.title: Life of St Thomas of Canterbury
msItem.incipit:
Gilbert was Tomas fadir þat trewe man was & gode
& loued god & holy cherche seþþe he wit ondirstode
msItem.explicit:
& for þat ilke swete loue þat seint tomas on þe þouȝt
brynge vs to þat ilke ioye þat he so dere abouȝt

msItem.incipit:
Seint mychel þe arcangel & his felawis al so
beþ by twene god & vs to techen what we scholde do
msItem.explicit:
& for þe mony fayre meraklis þat þoruȝ seint mychel com
hem let halwen myȝelmasseday þorwȝ out al cristindom

msItem.incipit:
Seint mychel in nouembre haþ ek anoþer day
by fore þe feste of seint luk as ich ȝou telle may
msItem.explicit:
& þat we moot oure soules saue & come to þilke blisse
Þat euere is wit outen ende & neuer ne chal mysse

msItem.title: All Saints Day
msItem.incipit:
Alle halewen day an erle we holdeȝ o tyme of þe ȝere
ffor fele enchesones þer to holy cherche vs gan lere
msItem.explicit:
& brynge vs to þat ilke ioye þere þat hy beþ inne
Ihesus for þy swete loue ne lete vs neuer ablynne

msItem.title: All Souls’ Day
msItem.incipit:
Alle soulen day an erþe ryȝt is to holden hyȝe
ffor alle we cholle habbe ned þer to & alle we cholleþ deye
msItem.explicit:
& lete vs here oure sinnes bete as we hennes wende
& come to þat ilke ioye þat euer is wit outen ende

msItem.title: Life of St Blase
msItem.incipit:
Seint blas clene lyf he ladde wit outen eny hore
In þe lond of capadosye þis godman was I bore
msItem.explicit:
oure lordes aungeles com sone & here soules bere to heuene
lord vs þedir brynge for þy names seuene

msItem.title: Life of St Wulfstan
msItem.incipit:
Seint Wolston bysschop of Wirecestre was her in ingelonde
swyþe holy man was alle his lyf as ich ondirstonde
msItem.explicit:
& brynge vs to þat ilke ioye þer he is inne I brouȝte
Iesus for þat ilke loue þat þu vs so dere abouȝte

msItem.title: Life of St Oswald the Bishop
msItem.incipit:
Seint oswold þe bysschop was bore her in ingelonde
of grete lordes he was come as ich ondirstonde
msItem.explicit:
ffor ȝeue þu oure mysdedys þat we doþ ofte amys
& brynge vs in to þy kyngdom In þe ioye of heuene blis

msItem.title: Life of St Edward the Elder
msItem.incipit:
Seint edeward þe ȝonge marter was kyng of ingelonde
wel ȝong I martret he was wit trecherye & onde
msItem.explicit:
bote good hit is wel to don whodir we euer wendeȝ
Ihesus for þyn holy name heuene blis þu us sende

msItem.title: Life of St Alphege
msItem.incipit:
Seint alphe þe marter þat good man was Inouȝ
I bore he was in ingelond & to holy lyf drouȝ
msItem.explicit:
Of oure mysdedes for ȝeuenesse & þin wille fulfille
& bryng vs to þyn ryche blisse & scheld vs fram þyne ille

msItem.title: Life of St Dunstan
msItem.incipit:
Seint donston was of ingelond I come of gode more
meraklis oure lord dede for hym ar he were I bore
msItem.explicit:
& wente to þe ioye þat neuer ne chal mysse
Now Ihesu for þyn holy name graunt vs þat ilke blisse

msItem.title: Life of St Aldhelm
msItem.incipit:
Seint aldelme þe confessour was man of noble lyue
I bore he was in ingelond þe kynges broþir sone yue
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we ȝerne syre aldelme oure erande to bere so
Þat we mote to þe ioye come þer he is in I do

msItem.title: Life of St Augustine of Canterbury
msItem.incipit:
Seint austin þat cristindom brouȝte in to ingelonde
ryȝt is a mon oþer I wis þat he be ondirstonde
msItem.explicit:
& graunt vs þat we mote after oure endyng day
come to þe ioye of heuene þat lasteþ euere & ay

msItem.title: Life of St Kenelm
msItem.incipit:
Seint kenelme þe ȝonge kyng þat holy marter is
Kyng he was of ingelond of þe march of Walis
msItem.explicit:
& marye mayde & modir bryȝt of ble þou praye þy swete sone
þat we mot also þorw þe in heuene ryche to wone

msItem.title: Life of St Swithin
msItem.incipit:
Seynt swiþþyn þe comfessour was her of ingelonde
by syde Winchestre he was I bore as I ondirstonde
msItem.explicit:
& for þe loue of seint swiþþin þat bysschop was her in ingelonde
þu bring vs to þe ioye of heuene þorwe oure lordes sonde

msItem.title: Life of St Leonard
msItem.incipit:
Seint leonard þe comfessour alonde ȝede her
after þat god on erþe com aboute fyf hondred ȝer
msItem.explicit:
& alle þat beþ in preson I brouȝt þorw synne of mankinde
Ihesu for seint leonardes loue þer of þou hem brynge

msItem.title: Life of St Martin
msItem.incipit:
Sein martin was I bore In þe lond of salarye
Wel ȝong he was I norched in þe londe of papye
msItem.explicit:
ffoure score winter he was old ar he deyde also
nowȝ god geue vs part of þilke ioye þat he was in I do

msItem.title: Life of St Edmund, Archbishop of Canterbury
msItem.incipit:
Seint edemond þe comfessour lyþ at pounteneye
of gode men & treue I come þey he were nouȝt wel hye
msItem.explicit:
ffor his loue we bidde god þat vs dere bouȝte
bringe vs to þe hyYe blis þat he his soule brouȝte

msItem.title: Life of St Edmund the King
msItem.incipit:
Seint edemond þe holy kyng of wham we makeþ gret feste
of þe on ende of ingelonde king was her be este
msItem.explicit:
Nou god for þe loue of seint edemond þat was so noble a kyng
Graunte vs þe ioye þat he is in after oure ending

msItem.title: Life of St Clement
msItem.incipit:
Seint clement was I bore at rome by þe olde dawe
& of þe hyeste men he com of rome þat weren by þulke lawe
msItem.explicit:
& þer he lyþ in his cherche Imad myd faire ginne
God ȝeue vs part of þe ioye þat his soule is inne

msItem.title: Life of St Katharine of Alexandria
msItem.incipit:
Seint caterine of nobil cinne come by olde dawe
here fadir king he modir quene in þe olde lawe
msItem.explicit:
Nouȝ Ihesu for þe swete loue of seint cateryne
Ȝif vs þe ioye of heuene & cheld vs fram helle pyne

msItem.title: Life of St Jacques the Martyr
msItem.incipit:
Seint ieme in þe lond of perce of hyȝe men come
sone he let þe false laue & tok to cristindome
msItem.explicit:
nouȝ god for þe gret ioye þat seint Iakes hadde
brynge vs to þilke ioye þat seint Iakes hadde

msItem.title: Life of St Andrew
msItem.incipit:
Seint Andrew þe apostle was seint petres broþir
oure lord hem brouȝt to cristindom hym & none oþir
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we ȝerne seint andreuȝ þat he vs so wisseþ
And praye for vs þat we mote come to heuene blisse

msItem.title: Life of St Nicholas
msItem.incipit:
Seint necolas þe good man þat good comfessour was
I come was of hy kim in þe cite of patras
msItem.explicit:
Bring vs to þat blisse þat is wit outen ende
& whan þat we beþ hennus I went oure soules þedir wende

msItem.title: Life of St Christopher
msItem.incipit:
Seint cristofre was an heþen man In þe lond of canaan
In no stede be his day me ne fond so strong a man
msItem.explicit:
Now Ihesus for seint cristofris loue soule bote vs sende
& bring vs after oure ending day to þe ioye wit outen ende

msItem.title: Legend of the Seven Sleepers
msItem.incipit:
Þe seue sleperis were holy men as men haþ ȝou I told be fore
In þe cyte of ephese hy weren alle I bore
msItem.explicit:
& bring vs to þe ioye þat neuer ne chal mysse
& oure soule þer to reste In heuen ryche blisse

msItem.title: Lives of Sts Philip and James

msItem.incipit:
Seint phelip & seint iacob apostles wern tweye
Þe ferste day þat comeþ in may deþ hy þoledin beye
msItem.explicit: & ne lete vs for owre mysdede neuer þat of blinne

msItem.incipit: Seint Iacob was oure lordes kinne & oure leuedy sostir sone
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we ȝerne seint phelip & seint iacob also
Þat oure soules mowe þorw hem In ioye of heuen ben do

msItem.title: Life of St Paul
msItem.incipit:
Seint poul was a leþer man ar he I comwerted were
alle cristinmen of þe londe hadde of hym gret fere
msItem.explicit:
& for þe loue of seint poul whas lif ich habbe I sede
bryng vs to þe ioye of heuene after þat we beþ dede

msItem.title: Life of St Julian Hosteler
msItem.incipit:
Seint Iulian þe herbeger of gode kynne come
stalworþ man & noble he was & loued cristindome
msItem.explicit:
& wente to þe ioye þat lestiþ wit oute ende
nouȝ Ihesu for seint iulianes loue vs graunte þedir to wende

msItem.title: Life of St Bridget (longer version)
msItem.incipit:
Seint bryde þe holy mayde of erlond ȝhe was
by ȝete ȝhe was in spousbreche & in a wonder cas
msItem.explicit:
at nouȝt so þat euer among sumþing þat mayde let dyȝt
Suþ hit by fal þer afterward þat þis mayde cholde

msItem.title: Life of St Agnes
msItem.incipit:
Seint anneys þe holy mayde wel ȝong ȝhe be gan
to serwin god & oure leuedy & ben cristin woman
msItem.explicit:
& saue vs alle fram dedly sinne þe whyle we beþ alyue
& bryng vs to þe blis þat ȝhe is in for his woundys fyue

msItem.title: Life of St Hilary
msItem.incipit:
Seint illary þe holy man of aquiteyne was
bysschop he was in þilke lond as oure lord ȝef þat cas
msItem.explicit:
He wente to þe ioye of heuen after his lyf anon
now god for þe loue of hym þedir vs bringe echon

msItem.title: Lives of SS. Fabian and Sebastian

msItem.incipit:
Seint fabyan by olde dawe good man was Inouȝ
at rome he ladde ioly lyf & to alle goodnesse drouȝ

Seint bastian was aman of wel gret honour
He serued dyoclisian þe heþen emperour
msItem.explicit:
& wente to þat ioye þat neuer ne chal mysse
now Ihesus for seint Sebastyanes loue graunt vs heuen blisse

msItem.title: Life of St Vincent
msItem.incipit:
Seint vincsent in spayne was & to a cristin bysschop com
Þat men cleped valerye & nom of hym cristindom
msItem.explicit:
now Ihesu for þe loue of hym lete vs soche lyf lede
þat we mote to heuene come & for ȝeue vs oure mysdede

msItem.title: Life of St Cuthbert
msItem.incipit:
Seint cotbert was I bore here in ingelonde
god dede many fayr merakles as ich ȝit ondirstonde
msItem.explicit:
In to þe grete ioye of heuene god lene vs don also
& þorwȝ þe bone of seint cotbert bring vs alle þer to

msItem.title: Life of St Benedict
msItem.incipit:
Seint benet was I bore in þe lond of vrcye
to rome he was wel ȝong I sent to lerne clergye
msItem.explicit:
Now god for þe loue of seint benet vs lete þat wey to wende
& to þe ioye þat he is in to hym come at þe ende

msItem.incipit:
Festen moble þat beþ I cleped fyue in þe ȝere
þe ferste is to loke aleluia oure penaunce to rere
msItem.explicit:
þat we cholde wit sorwe of herte oure penaunce here lede
& aȝen þe tyme of lente repenty oure mysdede
msItem.note: The three following texts do not have headings and are treated as a continuous work.

msItem.title: The Feast of the Annunciation
msItem.incipit:
Seint mary day in lente among oþer dayes gode
yȝt is for to holden hy who so hym ondirstode
msItem.explicit:
now bidde we Ihesus goddes sone þat þulke hy day wrouȝte
bringe vs to þat ilke ioye þat he vs to dere abouȝte

msItem.incipit:
Leynt comeþ þer afterward þat syx wekis lasteþ
oure synnus alle for to bete alle cristene men fasteþ
msItem.explicit:
so þat he mowe on estir day whan he haþ al I vaste
oure lordes flesch ondir fongen þat a swete mossel is at þe laste

msItem.incipit:
Þe holy feste of estir comeþ after lente anon
As oure lord ros fram deþ to lyue boþe in flesch & bon
msItem.explicit:
þe reuesony comep newen be fore seint markes day
þerfore we wolleþ tellen eftsone þe by gynnyng of may

msItem.title: Life of St Mary of Egypt
msItem.rubric: S Marie gipcien þe holy woman
msItem.incipit:
Seint marye egipciake In egipte was I bore
alle here ȝonge lyf ȝhe ladde in synne & ek In hore
msItem.explicit:
so to don aboue þis erþe ar we hennes wende
to come to þe ioye þat ȝhe is in after oure dayus ende

msItem.title: Life of St George
msItem.incipit:
Seint iorge þe holyman as we fyndeȝ I wryte
In þe lond of capadocye I bore he was & by ȝete
msItem.explicit:
& þere he is in gret ioye þat last wit outen ende
& god for þe loue of sent iorge vs lete alle þedir wende

msItem.title: Life of St Mark
msItem.incipit:
Seint mark þe holy godspeller wyde wente alonde
for to prechy cristindom þorw oure lordes sonde
msItem.explicit:
men goþ wit letanye a processioun in eche cherche by wone
to preye for þe wedering & mankynne & good hit is to done

msItem.title: Letania maior et minor
msItem.incipit:
Letanye is asong as ȝe mowe ofte I se
to bidde ech halwe after oþer oure help for to be
msItem.explicit:
Þat we holde so þis precessionis & þe fasting witoute synne
þat frut an erþe com wel forþ to helping to alle man kinne
msItem.note: No heading; treated as part of the preceding item.

msItem.title: Life of St Peter
msItem.incipit:
Seint peter þe frere prechour In þe cite of veronye
I bore was of mysbyleued men þat were al in erersyȝe
msItem.explicit:
now god for þe loue of seint peter bring vs to þilke blisse
þer þat he is brouȝt to & þer of þat we ne mysse

msItem.title: The ‘Early History’ of the Cross
msItem.rubric: Þe gynnyng of þe holy rode
msItem.incipit:
Þe holy rode þe swete tre ryȝt is to habbe In mende
þat haþ fram strong deþ I brouȝt to lyue alle mankende
msItem.explicit:
So þat þilke stede was for lete mony a day
þat no cristinman ne payemens neyste were þe rode lay

msItem.title: The Invention of the Cross
msItem.rubric: Þe finding of þe þre rodis
msItem.incipit:
A noble emperour com syþ þat het constauntin
In batayle he was so moche þat nas of no fyn
msItem.explicit:
vs so werie with þe rode þe fendes fonding wit stonde
boþe by nyȝt & by daye a water & ek alonde

msItem.title: The ‘Exaltation’ of the Cross
msItem.incipit:
Þe holyrode þat was I founde as ȝe wyteþ in may
an haunsed he was in septembre þe holyrode day
msItem.explicit:
now god for þe rode loue þat þu were on I do
bringe vs to þe hyȝe ioyȝe þat þu vs bouȝtist to

msItem.title: Life of St Julian the Confessor
msItem.incipit:
Seint Iulyan þe comfessour i bore was at rome
mony mon to cristindom þorw his preching come
msItem.explicit:
at þe ende of ieneuer þis comfessour so deide
god for þe loue of hym vs alle þedir to de

msItem.title: Life of St Gregory
msItem.incipit:
Seint gregor þe comfessour in sysile was I bore
Im haynesse he ladde his lyf þat he ne were forlore
msItem.explicit:
bidde we him wit good hert apostil of ingelonde
Þat to fore oure lord crist he bere oure erande

msItem.title: Life of St Lawrence
msItem.incipit:
Seint laurens good mon was And in strong martirdom
he ended on erþe his lif & to þe ioye of heuene com
msItem.explicit:
bringe vs to þat ilke blis þat lesteþ wit outen ende
& graunt vs alle þilke eritage & after oure day þedir wende

msItem.title: Life of St Hippolytus
msItem.incipit:
Seint yppolit þe marter kniȝt was of gret honour
Þat seint laurence in prisoun kepte þorw heste of þe emperour
msItem.explicit:
bring vs to þat blisse þat lesteþ euermore
for þe loue of seint Ipolit þat penaunce þoled sore

msItem.title: The Assumption of Our Lady
msItem.incipit:
Seint marye goddes modir fram þe apostlis nas nouȝt
þo þe holy gost a whitsonday among hem was I brouȝt
msItem.explicit:
Now Iesus for þin modir loue vs leue þedir to wende
& bringe vs to þe ioye of heuene þat is wit outen ende

msItem.title: Life of St Bartholomew
msItem.incipit:
Seint bartulmew þe apostil com of kinges blode
swyþe fayr & noble man he was glad & swete of mode
msItem.explicit:
Now idde we ȝerne seint bartilmeuȝ þat hy apostele is
þat we þe sonnere for his loue come to heuene blis

msItem.title: Life of St Giles
msItem.incipit:
Seint gilis þe holyman ne loued noþing synne
at attenes he was I bore he com of kinges kinne
msItem.explicit:
to þilke ioye he vs bring þat is wit outen ende
& graunt vs after oure ending daye þedir alle to wende

msItem.title: Life of St Justina
msItem.incipit:
Seint istine of hyȝe men in antioche com
Wel ȝong ȝhe louid Ihesu crist & tok to cristindom
msItem.explicit:
Now Ihesis for þe swete loue of þe mayde iustine
& for þe lour of sein siprian scheld vs fram helle pyne

msItem.title: Life of St Guthlac
msItem.incipit:
Seint gutlac was a goodman Ibore here in ingelonde
of his lif ich mot telle þat ic ondirstonde
msItem.explicit:
& leue vs so to don here þe whyle we beþ alyue
& to þin oune eritage vs bring for þy woundus fyue

msItem.title: Life of St Eustace
msItem.rubric: Seint eustas & his wyf & his twey sonus
msItem.incipit:
Seint eustace a noble knyȝt of heþen laue he was
ac er þan he cristenid was me cleped him placidas
msItem.explicit:
nowidde we seint eustas al wit outen steuen
þat he preye for vs to god þat he graunte vs þe blisse of heuen

msItem.title: Life of St Dominic
msItem.incipit:
Seint dompinke þe holy frere in spayne was I bore
in þe toun of cailre wel good was þe more
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we seint domenyk þat þe ordre haþ I brouȝt
þat we ben forþ wit him to þe ioye of heuene be tauȝt

msItem.title: Life of St Matthias
msItem.incipit:
Seint mathy apostil is as we cholleþ alle I wite
þorwȝ lot apostis he I makid was as we findeþ I write
msItem.explicit:
Now god for þe loue of hym lede vs here so wisse
Þat whanne we hennes wendiþ come to heuen blisse

msItem.title: Southern Passion
msItem.note: Separate sections usually associated with fols. 25v–41r.

msItem.incipit:
To his desiplis ihesus seyd by þese wordes ȝw mowe se
Þat I haue to ȝowȝ speke whyl h I haue wit ȝowȝ be
msItem.explicit: Or þe holy gost weres hem sent þey ne dorste out gon

msItem.rubric: Þe hiȝe feste of Whitsone tyd
msItem.incipit: At vnderne on Witsone day as þe apostlis stode & sete
msItem.explicit:
lord as þou fulfildist þy postlis wit þe holygost in erþe so
so fulfille vs here in erþe to heuin þat we streyȝt go

msItem.title: Feast of Corpus Christi
msItem.rubric: Þe feste of corpus day cristy
msItem.incipit:
Þe hyȝe feste of goddes blood þat late was I founde
good is to honoure In euery a stounde
msItem.explicit:
& god leue þat we moot þer to vs clensy so
þat we mowe þer þorwȝ be sauid fro pyne & fro wo

msItem.note: The lower half of 175r up to 176v are blank, at the end of an inserted quire.

msItem.title: Life of St Matthias
msItem.quote:
And by leued þorwȝ him on god & torned to cristindome
Þe leipr iustise of þe londe þer of I hurd telle
He lot neme þis holyman & in strong deþ a quelle
ac he nys nowher I founde in boke what deþ he hadde þere
as I martrid he was in strong torment as þe apostles were
Gode men com þer afterward & þat holy body nome
& out of þe lond of Iude ladde hit suþþen to rome
& beryid hit þere wit honour þer as me seeþ hym ȝute
In seint Mary chirch of rome his heued wit gret prite
& þus he ended his lyf as ich ȝouh told habbe
& in þis maner apostil I chose wit outin eny gabbe
Now god for þe loue of him lete vs here so wisse
þat whanne we hennes wendeþ come to heuene blisse
msItem.note: Original conclusion to Life of Matthias (final 13 lines) before leaves inserted between fols. 170 and 177. Repetition of lines now on fol. 171r inserted to complete Matthias before the new material.

msItem.title: Life of St Francis
msItem.incipit:
Þe valeye hatte spoletan þer saint franceys was I bore
& þe toun assisie so þe bok vs telleþ sore
msItem.explicit:
þat on deyde amorwe þat oþer deyde an eue
& so hy gonnen boþe þis wrecched lif byleue
msItem.note: Ends imperfectly near the head of the page with remainder of page blank.

msItem.title: Life of St Faith
msItem.incipit:
Ich wot in ferne contre so men me toldin to
Is a swyþe noble toun I cleped ageno
msItem.explicit:
Þe seueþe day of octobre þese goodmen þolid þis
Now Ihesu crist for here loue vs graunte heuen blis

msItem.title: Life of St Denis
msItem.incipit:
Sen denys In þe olde laue heþen as oþer were
In þe cyte of attenus þeras non oþer nere
msItem.explicit:
& bringe vs to þat ilke ioye þer þat hy beþ inne
& to oure kende eritage heuen blisse to winne

msItem.title: Life of St Nycasie
msItem.incipit:
After þat seint denys was þus I brouȝt of daweȝ
nycasie was bysschop þo of cristen men lawe
msItem.explicit:
& ȝeue vs space an erþe oure synnes to beten here
þat we mowe in heuene blis euere to wonie þere

msItem.title: Life of Pope Calixtus
msItem.incipit:
In þe lond of rome I bore was seint calston
to swyþe gret goodnesse he drouȝ in his ȝouþe anon
msItem.explicit:
& bring vs to þe ioye þat euermore I leste
& þer in to wonye & maken þer oure feste

msItem.title: Life of St Winifred
msItem.incipit:
Vonefreda was an holy mayde so ich ondirstonde
In þe tyme þe yre aleyn was king of ingelonde
msItem.explicit:
suþþe þo god sente his grace to heuen ȝhe gan wende
Now Ihesu for þe loue of here þedir vs bringe at oure ende

msItem.title: Life of St Luke
msItem.incipit:
Seint Luk þe gospeller non apostle nas
& þou he sewed þe apostlis & here desiple was
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we Ihesu for lukes loue þat good clerk was & wis
bring vs in to þat ilke ioye þer þat he in is

msItem.title: Life of St Illarion
msItem.incipit:
Gaza is a nobble toun In verre contre
In þe lond of spayne hit is so men hit telleþ me
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we god for þe loue of seint illarion
Þat he vs graunty þat blis þat ending naueþ non

msItem.title: Lives of Saints Crysanthus and Daria
msItem.incipit:
Polimus was a noble man in alisaundre I bore
knyȝt he was & gret lord so ic may telle ȝou fore
msItem.explicit:
& bring vs to þe ioye þat lesteþ euer more
þer þat þis twey marterus beþ þat wit pyne abouȝt so sore

msItem.title: The Eleven Thousand Virgins
msItem.incipit:
Ellewe þousen of maydenes þat a fayre compenye was
I marterd weren for cristes loue & wole tellen þat cas
msItem.explicit:
nowȝ god vs graunty for his gras þat we moot awinne
þe hyȝe blisse of heuene þer þis maydenes beþ inne

msItem.title: Lives of SS. Crispin and Crispinian
msItem.rubric: Crispin and crispinyan twey holi marteres
msItem.incipit:
Moche harme Ich habbe I told & more ic telle can
hy þe liþer emperour þat het maximian
msItem.explicit:
& bring vs to þe ioye þer þey wonneþ inne
& leue vs so an erþe to don to heuene blis awinne

msItem.title: Life of St Evarist
msItem.incipit:
Euarist þe holy pope so ich ondirstonde
was I bore by syde Ierusalem in þat ilke londe
msItem.explicit:
& þat he bere oure erande to god oure alþer kinge
Þat to þe ioye of heuene he vs alle bringe

msItem.title: Lives of SS. Simon and Jude
msItem.rubric: Seint Simon and Seint iude twey apostlus
msItem.incipit:
Seint symon & seint iude to breþerin were
Marye sonys cleophe as þe bok vs doþ lere
msItem.explicit:
Now Ihesu crist al myȝtey king for loue of hem to
scheldin vs fram helle pyne nowþe & euer mo

msItem.title: Life of St Firmin
msItem.incipit:
Seint firmin þe bisschop was of holy lyf
swyþe moche he hated velenye & stryf
msItem.explicit:
nouȝ bidde we alle Ihesu crist for loue of seint firmin
Þat he vs chelde fram senne & saue vs fram helle pin

msItem.title: Life of St Vital
msItem.incipit:
Vital was a noble man in þe lond of rome
& hadde many bonde men þat of him lond nome
msItem.explicit:
ffor þus vital & agricola here lyuus hy gonen ende
nouȝ Ihesu for here veyre loue graunte vs to heuen wende

msItem.title: Life of St Aldhelm
msItem.incipit:
Seint aldhelme þe confessour was man of noble lyue
I bore he was in ingelonde þe kingis broþer sone yue
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we ȝerne seint aldelme þat he oure erande bere so
þat we moot to þe opye come þat he is in Ido

msItem.title: Life of St Margaret
msItem.incipit:
Olde & ȝonge ich rede ȝou ȝoure folyis for to lete
& leueþ on crist þat haþ ȝou bouȝt ȝoure sinnes to bete
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we here bere oure erande myd wordes mylde & swete
þat we note to heuene come whan we oure lif doþ lete

msItem.title: Life of St Oswin
msItem.rubric: Seint oswin þe king þe holy marter
msItem.incipit:
In somtyme weren in ingelonde kingus swyþe ryue
for so ich finde in bok I wroȝt at onus þer weren fyue
msItem.explicit:
þat we after oure ending mot to him come
& wende to þe ioye þer þat he doþ wone

msItem.title: Life of St John the Baptist
msItem.incipit:
Good is to habbe in mende sein Ihon þe baptiste
ffor he was þe beste berne after Ihesu criste
msItem.explicit:
Seint Ihon þat in flom iordan cristenyd goddes sone
help vs to oure cristindom to þe ioy of heuen to come

msItem.rubric: Seint ihon & Seint poul twey breþerin of rome
msItem.incipit:
Ihon & poul breþerin were in þe borwȝ of rome
þe modir het costande þorw whom hy to þis world com
msItem.explicit:
þe vii calendr of Iulie þis cas fel I wis
nowȝ Ihesu þorw here bonys vs graunte heuen blis

msItem.title: Life of Pope Leo II
msItem.rubric: Seint lion þe pope þe ȝonge
msItem.incipit:
Þis lyon þe ȝonge In holywrit I cleped is
In rome he was pope ic ot to soþe I wis
msItem.explicit:
Ihesu crist in heuene vs graunte þedir to go
to þe blis of paradis þat lastiþ euer mo

msItem.title: Life of St Marius
msItem.rubric: Seint marius & his vif & his to sonis
msItem.incipit:
Marius was a good man fram capadosye I come
wit his wif & his to sonys to þe borw of rome
msItem.explicit:
Now Ihesu þat is in heuene þou art so fre & hende
Graunte vs þat we mote alle þedir wende

msItem.title: Life of St Peter
msItem.incipit:
Seint petir was wiþ oure lord on of þe apostlus hexte
& seint Ihon þe ewangelist for euer þey were him nexte
msItem.explicit:
seint peter þat heuene keyis kepeþ þorwȝ goddus grace
graunte vs þedir for to come & þer to habben a place

msItem.title: Life of St Swithin
msItem.incipit:
Seint swiþþin þe comfessour was I bore in ingelonde
by syde þe toun of Winchestre also ich ondirstonde
msItem.explicit:
vor he leet þe stronge brigge wit oute þe toun arere
& ford þerto lym & ston & workmen þat þer were
msItem.note: Crossed out; second occurrence in this MS.

msItem.title: Life of St Alban
msItem.incipit:
Seint albon þe holy man I bore was in ingelonde
I martrid he was for cristus loue wit chame & wit chonde
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we to Ihesu crist & to seint albon faste
þat we moot to þe ioye come þat euer chal I laste

msItem.title: Life of St Illurin (al. Silverius)
msItem.incipit:
Illurin þe pope þat holy marter is
Was I bore in grece as þe bok vs telleþ I wis
msItem.explicit:
þe xii calendre of iulie I buried he was þo
now god vs bringe to þe blis þat he was I do

msItem.title: Life of St Paulin (or Paul) the Hermit
msItem.incipit: On a tyme rengned in rome þe emperour decie
msItem.explicit:
Ihesu for paulinus loue ȝif it ben þy wille
Cheldin vs fram þe foule fend þat he vs nauȝt ne spille

msItem.title: Life of St Sylvester
msItem.incipit:
Anon þo þe emperour constauntin hadde his false goddus forsake
& þorwȝ siluestris lore hadde cristindom I take
msItem.explicit:
& þer wonye wit outen ende to oure ryȝt eritage
& for ȝiue oure sinnus alle þat we habbeþ I don outrage

msItem.title: Barlaam and Josaphat
msItem.incipit:
Ihon of damascene telleþ vs þe storiȝe
of barlaam & iosaphat to haue hem In memoryȝe
msItem.explicit:
now bidde we god of heuin þat euer was & is
þat he vs for here boþe loue bring to heuin blis

msItem.title: Life of St Remigius
msItem.incipit:
Þe holy bysschop remygye in france was I bore
a good whyle er he were be ȝete to crist he was I core
msItem.explicit:
& bring vs to oure eritage þat to vs alle is dyȝte
& þer to wonye wit him þat is oure alþer dryȝte

msItem.title: Life of Pope Anicetus
msItem.incipit:
Seint anyset þe holy man þat somtyme pope was
In þe borw of rome so god him ȝef þe cas
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we to Ihesu crist for loue of seint anyscete
þat he vs bringe to heuene for þer is ioye swete

msItem.title: Life of St Sother the Pope
msItem.incipit:
Sother þe holy pope in chaumpayne was I bore
of þe beste men of þe londe ic woot he nom his more
msItem.explicit:
þat he vs ȝeue grace here on erþe so do
oure soulus fram sinne sauen & after come þe to

msItem.title: Life of Pope Caius
msItem.incipit:
Gaye þe holy pope þat goodman was & hendeȝ
was of dyoclisianus þe emperourus kende
msItem.explicit:
Now Ihesu crist for þe loue þat he loued seint gay
þat he vs ȝeue his blessing so wel so he may

msItem.title: Life of St Emerentiana
msItem.incipit:
Seint anneys woned in rome so ich ȝou toldin ere
ȝhe hadde a fostirsostir þat wit here woned þere
msItem.explicit:
Bidde we to Ihesu crist for emerencianus loue
þat he vs granten þe blis þat is in heuen aboue

msItem.title: Life of Pope Hyginus
msItem.incipit:
Seint igin þe holy pope in rome was I bore
he hadde swyþe holy lif so ich may ȝou telle fore
msItem.explicit:
Now Ihesu bring vs to þe ioye þat he is I brouȝt
as þu wit þy fywoundes dere vs alle bouȝt

msItem.title: Life of Pope Miltiades
msItem.incipit:
Melchiades þe pope in affer I bore was
of swyþe good cristin kende so god gaf þe cas
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we god almyȝty king þat after oure ending
to þe ioy þat lesteþ euer oure soules þedir bring
msItem.note: References to þe pope later blacked out.

msItem.title: Life of Pope Damas
msItem.incipit:
Seint damas þe pope was I bore in spayne
þe whil he was a ȝong child he liste nouȝt to playne
msItem.explicit:
nowe prey we to Ihesu crist þat is so fre & hende
Whan we partiþ of þis world let vs to oure soules to heuene wende

msItem.title: Life of St Saturninus
msItem.rubric: Seint saturnin and cicin twey holy marteres
msItem.incipit:
A prest somtyme was in rome me cleped saturnyne
þat hadde wit him a dekene þat was I hote cysine
msItem.explicit:
Now Ihesu crist al myȝty god for here boþer loue
bring vs to þe blisse þat is in heuen aboue

msItem.title: Life of Pope Innocent I
msItem.incipit:
Þe holy pope Innosent so god ȝaf pe cas
In þe lond of abdane ich woot I bore he was
msItem.explicit:
to come to þe ioye þat he is in I dyȝt
for þe loue of innocent so wel so þou myȝt
msItem.note: Þe holy pope later blacked out.

msItem.title: Life of Pope Felix III
msItem.incipit:
Felix was I bore in rome sumtyme be olde dawe
his fader heet felix ek a man of þe olde lawe
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we god & seint felix þat he vs grace sende
þat we after oure ending day mot to heuene wende
msItem.note: Þe holy pope later blacked out.

msItem.title: Lives of SS. Simplice and Faustine
msItem.incipit:
Twey emperourus in som tyme was in þe lond of rome
þat slouin many a cristinman þorw wel wilfuldome
msItem.explicit:
& bringe vs to þe ioye þer þat hy beþ inne
& þat we mote oure ryȝt eritage wit ryȝt to oure soulus awinne

msItem.title: Lives of SS. Abdon and Ceman
msItem.rubric: Seint abdon and ceint cemen twey holy Marteris
msItem.incipit:
Seint abdon & seint ceman twey breþerin were
In þe lond of cordulis & weren kingus þere
msItem.explicit:
þat we mote so libbe here in world þisse
þat we moot alle come in to heuen riche blisse

msItem.title: Life of St Germanus
msItem.incipit:
Seint ierman þe holy man in anticiodence was I bore
In þe toun of indegen of swyþe nobil more
msItem.explicit:
Now bidde we alle to Ihesu crist for loue of seint Iermayn
þat he bringe vs to þe ioye þer þat he is in

msItem.title: Life of St Aethelwold
msItem.incipit:
Thelwold þe gode clerk was I bore in ingelonde
In his ȝonge lyue he hated sinne & chonde
msItem.explicit:
þer after anon his soule fro his body gan wende
In to þe blisse of heuene & god vs þedir sende

msItem.title: Life of St Martha and St Fronton
msItem.incipit:
Marþa was a good woman s al so ȝe hereþ telle
ȝhe herberuid Ihesu crist as we findeþ in þe gospelle
msItem.explicit:
& leue vs here on erþe doon oure sinnus to bete
& we mot to þat ioye come ar we oure lif here lete

msItem.title: The ‘Vernon’ Life of Mary
msItem.incipit:
Alle ȝe wetyn whan & how þe feste chal ben holde
of oure ladyes concepcioun as þe boke vs tolde
msItem.explicit:
& þus þey come togedere þat sondrid were so long
Iesus schelde vs from pyne of helle þat is so stronge

msItem.title: Life of St Lucy
msItem.incipit:
Seint lusie þat holy mayde In sysile was I bore
wel ȝong ȝhe gan to serue god & lefte sinne & hore
msItem.explicit:
Þere Yhe is wit Ihesu crist In ioyȝe wit outin ende
now Iesw for þat maydenus loue vs let þedir wende

msItem.title: Life of St Thomas the Apostle
msItem.incipit:
Seint tomas þa postil I martrid was In inde
of his lyf we mote rede as we in book doþ finde
msItem.explicit:
Now seint tomas þat in to Inde cristindom fyrst brouȝte
bringe vs to þe Ioyw of heuene to woch oure lord vs wrouȝte

msItem.title: Life of St Anastasia
msItem.incipit:
seint anastas was I bore at rome by olde dawe
of swyþe hyȝe men I come al of þe olde lawe
msItem.explicit:
þey stodin þere Imwasschiin some he walwid among hem fast
loþlicher schreue ne myȝte be ne so by baicced þe last

msItem.incipit:
Of a prophete I wil ȝouȝ telle his name was Ȝakarye
his wif hiȝte elyȝabeþ & goddus modir hyȝte maryȝe
msItem.explicit:
Now pray we him wit al oure myȝt þat wolde for vs so lowe alyȝt
soch grace þat he vs send þat we motin to heuene wend
msItem.note: C version, 251 line extract with a unique conclusion, four couplets. Lines 249–517, following heading on fol. 254v with the previous item, crossed out.

msItem.title: Life of St Anastasia
msItem.incipit:
Seint anastas was I bore at rome by olde dawe
& of swyþe hyȝe men ycome al of þe olde lawe
msItem.explicit:
& þe maner is mochil in erþe for to lyȝe lesinge
In to þe ioy þat ȝhe is inne god oure soulus bringe
msItem.note: Complete text; second occurrence in MS.

msItem.title: Life of St Stephen
msItem.incipit:
Seint Steuene was a Iew & of þe Iewes he com
& þorwȝ preching of þe a postlis cristindom he nom
msItem.explicit:
In þilke chirche his holy bonus were I don in chrine
Now god for þe loue of seint steuene schild vs from helle pyne

msItem.title: Life of St John the Evangelist
msItem.incipit:
Seint Ihon þe wangelist þat apostil al so is
was oure lordus auntis sone & seint Iames broþer I wis
msItem.explicit:
Now seint Ion þe wangelist ȝif it þy wille is
pray for vs alle þat we mote come to heuene blis

msItem.title: Of þe holi feste of inocens
msItem.rubric: Of þe holi feste of inocens
msItem.incipit:
Of þe holy feste of Inosent
þat endid here lyf In gret turment
Is good to honoure & to holde
boþe of ȝong & of olde
msItem.explicit:
Now lord king of heuene a boue
for his holy Inosentis [loue]
send vs grace so to spede
þat we haue heuene to oure mede

msItem.title: Life of St Mary Magdalene
msItem.incipit:
Seint mary maudeleyn þat god forȝaf here sinne
lasarus soster & martha þey come of kingus kinne
msItem.explicit:
now mary magdalen þat þus brouȝt here lyf to ende
bidde god þat we moot wit here to þe ioy of heuin wende

msItem.title: Life of St Birinus
msItem.incipit:
seint birrin þe comfessour þat good mon was I nowȝ
In þe toun of rome was bore & to ech goodnes drowȝ
msItem.explicit:
& went to þe ioy of heuin out of þis erþ anon
nou god for þe loue of hym bring vs þedir echon

msItem.title: The Conception of Mary
msItem.incipit:
Aftir þat anne wit childe was & þat wit ryȝt kinde
Ȝhe bar þat swete barn þat euer worþ in mynde
msItem.explicit:
Ȝhe was mayde widue & wif ȝe so is non þat haþ þe þre
now god for þe loue of here bring vs þer ȝhe be

msItem.title: Life of St Leger
msItem.incipit:
seint leger þe bysschop holy mon was I nowȝ
þorw his preching mony on to oure lord he drowȝ
msItem.explicit:
Now god for þe loue of sen leger soche grace vs sende
þat we alle to þe ioyȝe of heuin moot wende

msItem.title: Life of St Edward the Confessor
msItem.incipit:
seint edward þe gode king ryȝt is to haue in mende
bore he was in ingelond I wole telle of what kende
msItem.explicit:
god for þe loue of seint edward vs bringe to þe blis
& to þe hy ioyȝe of heuene þat his soule in is

msItem.title: Life of St Etheldreda
msItem.incipit:
Eþeldrede of ely gode mayde was & hende
here fadir was king of ingelond of al þe est ende
msItem.explicit:
of here me makeþ in holy chirche gret feste a ȝer I wis
now god for þe loue of here bring vs to heuin blis

msItem.title: Life of St Frideswide
msItem.incipit:
seint friswide þe mayde was her of ingelond
at oxinforde ȝhe was I bore as ich ondirstond
msItem.explicit:
& þer haþ be for here loue ofte gret bootnyng
nowȝ bid we god for here loue to þe ioyȝe of heuin vs bring

msItem.title: Life of St Eadburh
msItem.incipit:
seint edborwȝ þe holy mayde was her of ingelond
king edward here fadir was as I ondirstond
msItem.explicit:
now bidde we seint edborw þat þus brouȝt here lyf to ende
þat we moot forþ wit here to þe ioy of heuin wende

msItem.title: Life of St Quintin
msItem.incipit:
seint quintin þe marter of þe contre was of rome
for goddus loue he þolid deþ or he to heuin come
msItem.explicit:
Þey seyȝ heuin opin þer aȝen in he fley anon
now god for þe loue of hym bring vs þedir echon

msItem.title: Life of St Quiriac
msItem.incipit:
Seint quiriac þat bysschop was prechid goddus lawe
Iulian þe liþir emperour brouȝt him seþþe of dawe
msItem.explicit:
& his woule wente to heuene after his tormenting
now good for þe loue of hym to þilke ioy vs bring

msItem.title: Life of St Brice
msItem.incipit:
sein bryse wit seint martin was erchedekin here
to his lord seint martin he was contrarius in ech manere
msItem.explicit:
Now god for þe gret anoy þat seint bryse had here
grant vs for his loue of þe pyne of helle be skere

msItem.title: Life of St Cecilia
msItem.incipit:
seint sisile of nobil in kin bore was at rome
oure lord crist ȝhe louid wel er ȝhe fro cradil come
msItem.explicit:
now bidde we oure swete lord for here strong marterdom
bring oure soulus to þe ioyȝe þat here to com

msItem.title: Life of St Mildred
msItem.incipit:
seint myldre þe holy mayd to telle be ryȝt dom
bore was in ingelond in þe ferste cristindom
msItem.explicit:
& went to þe ioy of heuin þer as ȝhe ȝit is
now god vs wisse þilke wey þat we ne go amys

msItem.title: Life of St Barnabas
msItem.incipit:
seint barnabe þe apostil þat good was & hende
martrid he was for goddus loue in strong deþ at þe ende
msItem.explicit:
& þat we moot þer be god ȝeue vs soch grace
to sitte in þe ryȝt syde to se oure lordus face

msItem.title: Life of St Petronilla
msItem.incipit:
Seint pernel þe holy mayd ryȝt is to haue in mende
good womon ȝhe was ȝhe auȝte wel be kende
msItem.explicit:
to heuen ȝhe went clene mayd & is wit outin endyng
now god for þe loue of here to þilke ioy vs bring

msItem.title: Life of St Botolph
msItem.incipit:
Seint botolf þe holy monk & ek his broþer
bore were in ingelond as is many an oþer
msItem.explicit:
Nowȝ god for seynt botolf is loue soch grace vs sende
þat we to þilke ioyȝe come & so þe deuil schende

msItem.note: Marginal note summarizing the volume as containing saints’ lives, possibly written as a pen-trial.
Basic liturgical texts in Middle English.

msItem.incipit: Oure fadir
Hayl marie
I beleue in god
Almyȝty god haue merci on ȝow
I be knowe to god of heuene

supportDesc.support: Paper; four different types. Quire 2 and fol. 94 similar to Cercle, Briquet 3183; quires 3–6 similar to Hache, Briquet 7510; quire 8 (inserted) Balanace, not in Briquet, but cf. 4229; quires 7 and 9–14 Cœur, not in Briquet, but cf. 2615.
supportDesc.foliation: Foliation from the 16th century, 1–306; this omits leaves after 110, 128, 141, 229, 241, 252. These leaves are now numbered 110a, 110b; 128a, 128b; etc.
supportDesc.collation: 12, 240+1 (fol. 43 a singleton), 326 (= 69), 424 (= 93), 526 (= 118), 626 (= 142), 726+2 (fols. 150–51 inserted after 7; = 170), 86 (inserted quire, probably misbound), 924 (= 200), 10–1126 (= 250), 1224+3 (fols. 255–57 inserted after 5; = 276), 138, 1424 (22 = fol. 306b, 23-24 pasted against the board). Quires reinforeced for binding by strips of parchment on the inner and outer folds. Catchwords up to fol. 226. No signatures.

layoutDesc.layout: Traces of ruling in red crayon. One column with 41 (fol. 4r) to 60 (fol. 118r) lines, ruled space 248 157

handDesc.handNote: Written and extensively corrected likely by a single scribe in multiple phases in a cursive Anglicana.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red initial on a geometrical background at the beginning of the volume. Smaller initials introduce new works and occasionally major sections (mostly unfinished after fol. 270r).
Red paraphs. Rubrics on fols. 10–25 replaced with running heads in a blue or red frame (reversed on fol. 244r).

binding.p: Contemporary white leather on boards, English.

Rebound in 1998. A phase-box contains the two wooden boards of the medieval binding, as revealed and preserved during a conservation programme of 1988–98. The fragmentary ends of the laced-in thongs and of the leather straps have been left in place where they survive in the upper board.

The larger lengths of thongs as preserved from the spine are now mounted inside the lid of the present box. The tawed leather which covered the boards has been lifted and stored at the end of the separate fascicule of fragments.

The former lower pastedowns are bound in at the end of the main text-block within its new binding, since they comprise the last two leaves of the final quire (XIII); they were lifted from the boards in 1988–9 and then foliated 308–309. The inside front board must already have been bare in the 17th century, when a smaller piece of paper of that period was pasted directly onto the wood: it was lifted during conservation and is now stored at the front of the separate fascicule. The fascicule also contains a selection (those with fragments of redundant writing) of the original parchment strengtheners which had been used to line the folds at the inside and outside of each quire, some or all before the main writing-campaign; some of the other strengtheners (blank parchment, and/or written over in the main script) have been left in place in the text-block.

history.origin:
15th century, second quarter
English . Görlach notes that the compiler modifies the orthography of the source texts to a Hampshire dialect (LP 5470).
history.acquisition: Presented by William Harwood, prebendary of Winchester, in 1611.

recordHist.source: Description by Andrew Dunning (January 2021), based in part on the Digital Intex of Middle English Verse; and Manfred Görlach, The Textual Tradition of the South English Legendary (Leeds, 1974), pp. 75–77. Previously described in the Summary Catalogue (1922). Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 429

revisionDesc.change: Andrew Dunning Revised with consultation of original.
